author: itv.com
title: Faster than the speed of sound: How well do you know the Bloodhound? | West Country (E)
text:
The Bloodhound's carbon footprint is that of 4 lactating cows. Credit: Flock London The supersonic car known as the Bloodhound is being unveiled today
The Bristol-built, much-anticipated racer is debuting in London, then going on public display. It aims to break world records by reaching speeds of more than 1,000 miles per hour.
You might have heard a lot about the Bloodhound in recent weeks, but did you know...
It does a mile in 3.6 seconds Its jet engine could suck all the air out of an average-sized house in 3 seconds Its carbon footprint is the equivalent of 4 lactating cows The temperature in its rocket is 3000C - twice as hot as inside a volcano The drag on it when it's doing 1000mph is 20 tons If fired straight up into the air it would reach 25,000ft Last updated Thu 24 Sep 2015 Read more 2 updates Supersonic Bloodhound making its debut Technology Bristol Bloodhound
